When you look for a language class to take here, you have to consider two things: which language you want to take and how much you will enjoy the instruction of that language at Harvard.

As far as the Arabic language is concerned, I characterize it as the Stilton cheese of foreign languages for an English speaker.  I am sorry if that sounds pretentious, but I think it's a good analogy.  If you enjoy learning languages, their new alphabets, vocabulary, and grammar, I think you will love Arabic.  If you're not a big language person to begin with, I suspect you'll hate Arabic.  There are lots of complicated grammatical rules and of course, there are few cognates.  So I think it takes a fair amount of dedication to take this language.  In that light, I would not recommend taking this language class if you are not a language person but want to take an exotic language just to fulfill the language requirement.  There are much easier languages you could take for the requirement that are just as exotic.  Similarly, I don't think you should just take this language on a whim.  As I said, it takes a ton of effort, and if you are not really committed to it, I think it will probably become frustrating.

As far as how this class is taught, I really have no complaints.  My teacher, Feryal Hijazi, is by far the best teacher I have had at Harvard.  She is extremely enthusiastic about the language and her students.  She will take an extra at office hours every time she has them if her students need her, and she would do that at the drop of a hat.  She is dedicated, first and foremost, to making sure you get the most out of the class.  I find that the class prepares you well to speak, read, and write quite a bit in a short period of time.  In my experience, though, that means the class covers the materials very quickly, and, of course, you have to go five days a week, and I think you should take advantage of all the office hours that are offered to maximize your learning.  

So, if you are not turned off by the difficulties of the language and are completely willing to spend a good deal of time on it, I think you will have a wonderful experience in Arabic A because of both the teachers and the language itself.  I wholeheartedly recommend this class.
